entry.title: Interesing Thingys 23
entry.content:
This week again with tons of new exciting links form the web and programming front…

JavaScript

  • Mozilla's Dev Derby Contest for July: Build Something Without JavaScript
  • JavaScript Profiling With The Chrome Developer Tools
  • Percentage Loader: jQuery Plugin to Display Progress
  • Radi 0.9 Adds Support for Realtime WebGL Visual Effects
  • Gamecore.js: increase javascript game performance by 1200% | Playcraft

CSS

  • How to Create Simple Timed Notifications with CSS Animations
  • Pondasee: A Front-End Starter Kit with SCSS and Compass
  • Ceaser - CSS Easing Animation Tool - Matthew Lein

  • Google I/O Recap from a HTML5 Game Development Perspective
  • Turning the Web Up to 11: The Web Audio API
  • Crunching Megapixels in WebGL
  • Creating a Slider Control with the HTML5 Range Input
  • HTML5 Validator with Error Filters
  • Cinderblock: A Stripped Down HTML/CSS Boilerplate for Starting Any Project

  • augustl/ruby-openssl-cheat-sheet

Tools

Databases

  • From Zero to API Cache w Grape & MongoDB in 10 minutes by Daniel Doubrovkine, - YouTube

Miscellaneous

  • java leap second bug – 30 June / 1 July 2012 – fix » WPKG Blog » Blog Archive
  • Microsoft on Test the Web Forward
  • Why You Need To Hire Great Developers | benlakey.com

  • Matraka: A Demo in 1005 Bytes

entry.title: Interesing Thingys 22
entry.content:
This week with an uncountable number of various categories…

Tools

  • HTTPie - a curl-like tool for humans.
  • Unicode String Generator - ever needed unicode test strings?

Mac

  • Satellite Eye - automatically change your desktop wallpaper to the satellite view of where you are.

iOS

  • Test Studio - a mobile testing solution for iOS. For native & web apps, .. looks promising.
  • Google’s Chrome Browser Now Works On The iPhone And iPad

Android

  • Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean)

JavaScript

  • jQuery Blog » jQuery 1.8 Beta 1: See What’s Coming (and Going!)
  • Better Web Templating with AngularJS 1.0 - Google Developers Blog
  • Node v0.8.0

CSS

  • Horizontal Box: Polygon Intersection for CSS Exclusions
  • The amazing powers of CSS - HTML5Rocks Updates
  • css3ps - Photoshop plugin that can convert layer styles to CSS3

HTML(5)

  • Hypertext Style: Cool URIs don't change.
  • TinyPNG – Compress PNG images while preserving alpha transparency
  • An Introduction to Content Security Policy - HTML5 Rocks
  • devicePixelRatio - QuirksBlog

Ruby

  • Rails 4.0 Sneak Peek: Queueing
  • Rails 4.0 Sneak Peek: Asynchronous ActionMailer
  • RR 60 SOLID with Jim Weirich
  • Changellog Episode 0.8.2 - Ruby Motion, MacRuby and more with Laurent Sansonetti
  • Poll: What is your primary Ruby editor

Clojure

  • Clojure Tutorial For the Non-Lisp Programmer | Moxley Stratton

Java

  • Java 8 lambdas

Databases

  • Redis Tips - MDN
  • Implementing Aggregation Functions in MongoDB
  • Paging & Ranking With Large Offsets: MongoDB vs Redis vs PostgreSQL

Git

  • A Visual Git Reference

Vim

  • Using vim-cmd To Power On Virtual Machines

Editors and IDEs

  • Sublime Blog » Sublime Text 2.0 Released
  • Chris Granger - It's playtime - Light Table Playground released
  • Eclipse Juno (4.2) Released
  • Jarvis - Python coding companion and Light Table clone

Various

  • I introduced my 5-year-old and 2-year-old to startx and xmonad. They’re DELIGHTED! | The Changelog xmonad | the tiling window manager that rocks
  • Sexy prime - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
  • Infinite-capacity wireless vortex beams carry 2.5 terabits per second | ExtremeTech
  • ZeroMQ: Disconnects are Good for You | Armin Ronacher's Thoughts and Writings

entry.title: Interesing Thingys 21
entry.content:
This week some Interesting Thingys from CSS, JavaScript, Ruby, and much more.

Vim

  • Vim Clutch
    Give Vim a pedal to speed up your typing

Programming

  • I can’t believe I’m praising Tcl
  • How to write a good bug report - Noverse
  • 50 Web Developer Documentation Manuals You Need To Know About
  • Falsehoods programmers believe about time: Noah Sussman: Infinite Undo
    This is kind of a fun one, at least as long as it does not happen to you.

HTML

  • html - Is it possible to make a div 50px less than 100% in CSS? - Stack Overflow

CSS

  • Eric's Archived Thoughts: Combining ‘nth-of-type()’ With Negation
  • Photon | CSS 3D Lighting Engine
  • 3D Thumbnail Hover Effects
  • Debunking Responsive CSS Performance Myths - igvita.com

JavaScript

  • Pull Request #2370: Allow dashes in identifiers, mangle them. by paulmillr · jashkenas/coffee-script
  • Backbone Aura by addyosmani
  • highlight.js
  • SeuratJS - A Raphaël plugin for creating beautiful pointilized animations.
  • Backbone UI
  • javascript - Why are my balls disappearing? - Stack Overflow
  • Introduction to JavaScript | adamonio.us

C#

  • The theory behind covariance and contravariance in C# 4 | Blog | TomasP.Net

Ruby

  • Myron Marston » RSpec's New Expectation Syntax
  • Removing config.threadsafe! | Tenderlovemaking
  • ruby++: Ubuntu 12.04 Ruby on Rails Development Environment
  • fredwu/api_taster
    A quick and easy way to visually test out your Rails application's API.
  • ruby-talks/talks
    now your ruby and command-line tools can talk with you

GIT

  • Filipe Kiss : A better git log

entry.title: Interesing Thingys 20
entry.content:
The 20th issue features lots articles on windows, css, javascript, and much more.

Windows Console

  • ConEmu - Windows console emulator with multiple consoles tabs
  • Windows console window enhancement. Last stable release 2005-09-22!!! The beta works great!
  • Gow (Gnu On Windows)
    is the lightweight alternative to Cygwin

Databases

  • SQL Fiddle
    like jsFiddle but for SQL

Programming

  • Study of 49 programmers: static type system had no effect on development time
  • The Architecture of Open Source Applications (Volume 2): nginx
  • wsdemo/results.md at master · ericmoritz/wsdemo - previous results
    C10K Websocket Test: testing Erlang, Java, Go, NodeJs, Python, Haskel

CSS

  • iOS 6 Adds Web Audio API and CSS Filters to Safari
  • CSS3 Filters: Altering HTML and Images with just CSS | InsertHTML
  • Webkit - Implement CSS Variables Standard
  • necolas/idiomatic-css
    Principles of writing consistent, idiomatic CSS
  • GradientFinder - Convert your Images into CSS Gradients
  • jorgebastida/glue
    Glue is a simple command line tool to generate CSS sprites

Java

  • Why isn't Java used for modern web application development? - Programmers Stackexchange

Vim

  • Advanced Vim macros | Arabesque

Clojure

  • nathanmarz/cascalog
    Cascalog is a fully-featured data processing and querying library for Clojure or Java. The main use cases for Cascalog are processing "Big Data" on top of Hadoop or doing analysis on your local computer.

OS X

  • CheatSheet
    displays a cheatsheet of shortcuts when you hold down the command key
  • Fish Finally, a command line shell for the 90s

JavaScript

  • BackboneConf 2012 Keynote by Jeremy Ashkenas - YouTube
  • Christian Johansen - Pure, functional JavaScript on Vimeo
  • Socialite.js
    Socialite provides a very easy way to implement and activate a plethora of social sharing buttons — any time you wish.
  • gravityonmars/Balloons.IO
    Chatserver based on NodeJs, Redis and SocketIO
  • vdemedes/joconut
    ever load a full page over and over again.

Ruby

  • Keynote - Yukihiro Matsumoto on Vimeo @ Euroku
  • Introducing the Giant Robots Smashing into other Giant Robots Podcast
  • Part of DataMapper 2 Is Done – Announcing Virtus 0.5.0
    solnic.eu - Attributes on Steroids for Plain Old Ruby Objects
  • Mina
    Really fast deployer and server automation tool
  • Ruby Fiddle
    like jsFiddle for Ruby

Hosting / Server

  • AppFog
    Heroku alternative
  • Xip.IO
    xip.io is a magic domain name that provides wildcard DNS for any IP address.

Time to watch

  • Zed A. Shaw - The Web Will Die When OOP Dies
    nice rant on the current front end tech stack
